meanings.def: to refuse to obey or show respect for somebody in authority, a law, a rule, etc.
examples: I wouldn't have dared to defy my teachers.
Hundreds of people today defied the ban on political gatherings.
He is willing to defy his own party.
Journalists were openly defying the authorities.
The protesters continued to defy a court injunction.

meanings.def: to be impossible or almost impossible to believe, explain, describe, etc.
examples: a political move that defies explanation
The beauty of the scene defies description.
His face was so odd that it defies description.

meanings.def: to successfully resist something to a very unusual degree
examples: The baby boy defied all the odds and survived (= stayed alive when it seemed certain that he would die).

meanings.def: used to say that somebody should try to do something, as a way of emphasizing that you think it is impossible to do it
examples: I defy anyone not to cry at the end of the film.
I defy you to leave without buying something.

idioms.idiom: I defy you/anyone to do something
idioms.def: used to say that somebody should try to do something, as a way of emphasizing that you think it is impossible to do it
examples: I defy anyone not to cry at the end of the film.
I defy you to leave without buying something.
